intro: Ardisia poranthera, commonly known as the red-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, red berries that are produced during the flowering season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. The berries are an important food source for various bird species, contributing to its ecological significance.
